Reviews.Title: Fair Plan for BlackBerry
Reviews.Author: Nathan M. Smith "Nathan Smith"
Reviews.Content: The Boost Unlimited Blackberry plan at $60/month is the best value in any BlackBerry plan offered in the U.S. at the moment and with no contract it was a sweet deal that I couldn't pass up. My contract with Sprint ended, and I decided to switch.I previously had an HTC Snap Smartphone. I asked the sales representative who sold the Boost BlackBerry Curve to me, "Why on earth would Sprint (who owns Boost) offer this plan for $40-$50 less on Boost then on Sprint?" I figured out the caveats on my own.Here's the scoop: Sprint stepped down the speed from EVDO Rev.0 to EVDO Rev.A, which means although technically it's "3G", It's much slower than using a BlackBerry Curve 3300 with Sprint on a contract. The browser is noticeably more slow then what I was used to. Secondly, the Boost Mobile version will not roam on other CDMA carriers (Verizon Wireless) which significantly cuts down the coverage areas, especially rural areas.Boost Mobile was also unable to port my phone number from Sprint. Strange since they run on the same Sprint CDMA network. The customer service rep chalked it up to a systems limitation. I gently reminded him of the FCC mandate that all wireless carriers must comply with porting requests. He seemed to be unconcerned. So I have a new phone number.I also wish Boost Mobile would have other BlackBerry plans - like a 1000 minute/unlimited data plan for $40, since I don't talk on the phone that much and don't really need unlimited minutes.Overall, the BlackBerry Curve 3300 device itself is great. It's intuitive, great for messaging, and easy to type with. The battery life is excellent. The $60/month plan is fair despite Boost Mobile (Sprint) crippling bandwidth and roaming capabilities.

Reviews.Title: Slow and hard to use
Reviews.Author: Dave Capper
Reviews.Content: I received this phone within two days of ordering it ... hard to get it activated ... had to call provider to show me a back end way to activate it. Took three attempts to "provision" it to work.Added a few apps and now it says memory is too low delete some of the apps. Browser is very slow.I thought of the Blackberry because of the apps but apparently cannot use them. I now pay 10 bucks a month MORE for service because it is a Blackberry, only to find I could have used a cheaper plan and been more happy.I would not recommend this phone.

Reviews.Title: Customer Service
Reviews.Author: Robert "RPB"
Reviews.Content: Great phone, but Boost Mobile customer service lacks. Very hard to talk to a human being. The 800# is like being on a merry-go-round. Unless you're setting up your service. And online access gives little opions.

Reviews.Title: Freezes, crappy internet
Reviews.Author: Lejune
Reviews.Content: It freezes, and had bad internet. Other than that, I love it. The keyboard, email, and facebook are addicting! I'm considering updating to a better service/model.

Reviews.Title: Very Pleased
Reviews.Author: MARGARET R CRAIG
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love how this phone was in PERFECT condition when it arrived. It works great. No Boost Mobile store around my area has this phone. Great price as well!

Reviews.Title: Great Deal
Reviews.Author: Brent Eckerd
Reviews.Content: I love my phone. It is all i expected it to be and the price was affordable. I got it on the time they said and the company handle every aspect with great concern. Loving my phone!!

Reviews.Title: New Bestie!
Reviews.Author: Chiquita
Reviews.Content: This phone is the greatest! I owned several touch-screen phones in the past, but none of them compared to the Blackberry! It is reliable and dependable! make sure you get a memory card with it though, so you can save your pics and such. The only issue I had, which isn't a huge issue, is that there is no timer on the camera for taking pictures. My other phones had a timer and I could take my own pics by setting up the phone to 30 seconds and having it snap them. But I absolutely love this phone.

Reviews.Title: it is what it is
Reviews.Author: willm
Reviews.Content: its a good phone for its purpose, it has an excellent keyboard, the battery life isnt bad as long as you arent running a thousand things, and the screen quality is good for its age, in my opinion the web browser is a little slower, but really its not unbearably slow it works decently quick, of course you also have to consider how well sprints signal is in your area, but with this phone you are going to end up spending more each month for a phone service thats not as capable as a newer android phone (which you can find cheaper now in some instances) i do like the shape and feel of the phone its built well, i think the track ball is cool its like a mouse in the web browser, i have heard of people having trouble with the track ball, my track ball has worked well, they do have replacement track ball kits available that are easy to install, all in all its a nice little phone

Reviews.Content: i like my phone but i was told at a boost store it was a two way in it why they don't have a blackberry from boost they better have a few new phones with 2way in it . i want to see a blackberry phone with 3G to 4G plus 2way or something like a EVO that can do 3G or 4G with 2way and 2 prices on service 45 for 1000 minutes or 60 for free everything . boost use to be 2way phones now they are getting out of the 2way thing is bull and boost needs to give more opions on their phones than people like to use .

Reviews.Title: blackberry 8330

Reviews.Content: I was really impressed by all the selections that are on amazon. I have beenwanting a blackberry phone for boostmobile. And found it at a real good price I am very happy with my purchace

Reviews.Title: Good phone
Reviews.Author: Auds
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love my blackberry BUT my stupidity about the coverage map for Boostmobile IDEN vs. CDMA has me without service at my home. So I am not using it unless I am going to be in an area with service for a while (which works fantastic!). This BB is wonderful with or without service. It is very good quality and robust :D I have dropped it maybe 20x since I bought this last August and there is not one scratch or glitch!! It came with everything I need for it and even a 1GB sd card in it :) takes amazing pictures & holds a lot of ringtones, songs, pics and vids.Just remember that this is a cdma phone so look at the cdma coverage map, if you get service buy this phone immediately. It is like the best phone I have ever had.

Reviews.Title: 8300 Blackberry
Reviews.Author: Genny "Geneva T. Hinton"
Reviews.Content: I received my 8330 a week ago. It was very easy to activate. So far so good. Great shipping.....I received my device very quickly.

Reviews.Title: Terrible coverage and service
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: I was with Boost Mobile for a little over 2 years, they were great at first but then one day I had no cell phone coverage where I lived. No bars at all for a month, I couldn't even call 911 if I wanted to, after that month I switched carriers. The customer service was totally unhelpful. I had emailed and called them more than once and they could not explain to me why I was not getting any service and they didn't refund my money back for that month. I went on facebook and a ton of other people were having the same experience. I went to their website several times and on their coverage map it showed that I had service even though I didn't. I feel sorry for people who order an expensive phone through Boost Mobile, thinking that their coverage map is accurate only to find out that they don't have and service. Sprint should be ashamed of themselves since Boost Mobile is owned by them.

Reviews.Title: Kevin Miranda
Reviews.Author: Kevin Miranda
Reviews.Content: The battery was red and couldnt charge, so l bought a new battery for $45.00 and the phone still does not charge, the phone does not let me download apps and it cost me $175.00 so far"I could make phone calls ". Thanks for nothing, I will not be making any more donations through Amazon. Dont reply unless its for reinbursement!

Reviews.Title: Less than par.
Reviews.Author: Robert Davis
Reviews.Content: Having previously owned Blackberry's I thought this phone would be a cheap replacement until the 9310 came out... I was dead wrong. Upon arriving, the the scroll ball was already coming loose from the phone and the phone froze often. I could hardly use it, not to mention it has a odd sized charger so if I left my charger at home or in the car, I couldn't use anyone elses which resulted in me having a dead battery a lot of the time. Don't buy this product, I'd opt for the 9310.
